Life goes on under anti-drone nets for Izium, in northeastern Ukraine
subhead: Anti-drone mesh nets now cover the city of Izium, located about 100 kilometers from Kharkiv. Most residents feel reassured by these makeshift defenses, but for others, they serve as a stark reminder of the ever-present threat that looms over them.

title: Ultra-conservative’s election win gives Chile its most right-wing president since dictatorship
subhead: José Antonio Kast won more than 58% of the votes as Chileans embraced his pledge to crack down on crime, deport illegal immigrants and revive the economy.

title: Why is the international far-right movement obsessed with Sweden?
subhead: While Sweden has been governed by a coalition of right and far-right parties since 2022, it has been portrayed by the online far-right sphere as the 'rape capital of the world.' This anti-immigration strategy is based on highly distorted statistics.

title: Nearly a year after California's devastating wildfires, Altadena's residents fear gentrification
subhead: Not incorporated into Los Angeles County, this California town has long served as a refuge for many African-American families. But the devastation caused by the January 2025 wildfire has pushed many homeowners, not all of them Black, to put their properties up for sale.

Mory Sacko, the calm celebrity chef: 'I have no score to settle with life'
subhead: He rose to fame on 'Top Chef' in 2020 and has since become a charismatic figure in France's new wave of gastronomy. At the helm of Mosuke, his Michelin-starred restaurant in Paris, Mory Sacko has created a small culinary empire built on joy and serenity.

title: France moves to phase out support system for Ukrainian refugees
subhead: With budget constraints tightening, aid and accommodation for displaced Ukrainians in France are gradually winding down. Many complex situations remain unresolved, leaving families without a path to independence.

title: The forgotten war between France and Cameroon
subhead: Historians comment on seven photographs that bear witness to the crimes committed by France in the African country between 1955 and 1971.
